messages.subject: Re: The Horse is Dead etc.
messages.msgSnippet: ... We/they will, when we re all ready. I don t know if you re a newbie to mailing lists in general or just this one, but you ll start to recognize the cycles
messages.messageBody:
----------
>From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1215
>Date: Tue, May 8, 2001, 10:21 AM
>

> I know I've only been here a few weeks but I was really looking for a group
> of folks that we tolerant and understanding of the differences in the
> choices people make. The past few days have been one post after another
> hammering the same subject. Most, if not all, of us have thrown in our two
> cents. Move on.


We/they will, when we're all ready. I don't know if you're a newbie to
mailing lists in general or just this one, but you'll start to recognize the
cycles that mailing lists MUST go through. People have to keep going until
they're done. If you or I are done with the topic, we just have to use our
delete key and some patience. :) It would be a real shocker if the spanking
discussion/debate persisted longer than a week. By then, even the most
passionate have had enough.

Breathe in. Go plant some flowers. If it's making you insane, just delete
all the mail for 7 days and come back, I guarantee the topic will have moved
on. Of course, it will come back again, like an annoying relative, at
regular intervals. The quicker we accept this is so, the less we have to
fuss and stress over it.

No sarcasm or irritability intended,

Pam
